verses.verse: And Shephatiah<WH8203> the son<WH1121> of Mattan<WH4977>, and Gedaliah<WH1436> the son<WH1121> of Pashhur<WH6583>, and Jucal<WH3116> the son<WH1121> of Shelemiah<WH8018>, and Pashhur<WH6583> the son<WH1121> of Malchijah<WH4441>, heard<WH8085> the words<WH1697> that Jeremiah<WH3414> spake<WH1696> unto all the people<WH5971>, saying<WH559>,

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, He that abideth<WH3427> in this city<WH5892> shall die<WH4191> by the sword<WH2719>, by the famine<WH7458>, and by the pestilence<WH1698>; but he that goeth forth<WH3318> to the Chaldeans<WH3778> shall live<WH2421>, and his life<WH5315> shall be unto him for a prey<WH7998>, and he shall live<WH2421>.

Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, This city<WH5892> shall surely<WH5414> be given<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the army<WH2428> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>, and he shall take it<WH3920>.

Then the princes<WH8269> said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, Let this man<WH376>, we pray thee<WH4191>, be put to death; forasmuch<WH3651> as he weakeneth<WH7503> the hands<WH3027> of the men<WH582> of war<WH4421> that remain<WH7604> in this city<WH5892>, and the hands<WH3027> of all the people<WH5971>, in speaking<WH1696> such words<WH1697> unto them<WH376>: for this man seeketh<WH1875> not the welfare<WH7965> of this people<WH5971>, but the hurt<WH7451>.
And Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> said<WH559>, Behold<WH3027>, he is in your hand; for the king<WH4428> is not he that can<WH3201> do anything against you<WH1697>.

Then took<WH3947> they Jeremiah<WH3414>, and cast<WH7993> him into the dungeon<WH953> of Malchijah<WH4441> the king<WH4428>'s son<WH1121>, that was in the court<WH2691> of the guard<WH4307>: and they let down<WH7971> Jeremiah<WH3414> with cords<WH2256>. And in the dungeon<WH953> there was no water<WH4325>, but mire<WH2916>; and Jeremiah<WH3414> sank<WH2883> in the mire<WH2916>.

Now when Ebed-melech<WH5663> the Ethiopian<WH3569>, a<WH376> eunuch<WH5631>, who was in the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, heard<WH8085> that they had put<WH5414> Jeremiah<WH3414> in the dungeon<WH953> (the king<WH4428> then sitting<WH3427> in the gate<WH8179> of Benjamin<WH1144>,)
Ebed-melech <WH5663> went forth<WH3318> out of the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, and spake<WH1696> to the king<WH4428>, saying<WH559>,

My lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>, these men<WH582> have done evil<WH7489> in all that they have done<WH6213> to Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030>, whom they have cast<WH7993> into the dungeon<WH953>; and he is like to die<WH4191> in the place<WH8478> where he is<WH6440>, because of the famine<WH7458>; for there is no more bread<WH3899> in the city<WH5892>.

Then the king<WH4428> commanded<WH6680> Ebed-melech<WH5663> the Ethiopian<WH3569>, saying<WH559>, Take<WH3947> from hence thirty<WH7970> men<WH582> with thee<WH3027>, and take up<WH5927> Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> out of the dungeon<WH953>, before he die<WH4191>.

So Ebed-melech<WH5663> took<WH3947> the men<WH582> with him<WH3027>, and went<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of the king<WH4428> under the treasury<WH214>, and took<WH3947> thence rags<WH5499> and worn-out<WH1094> garments<WH4418>, and let them down<WH7971> by cords<WH2256> into the dungeon<WH953> to Jeremiah<WH3414>.

And Ebed-melech<WH5663> the Ethiopian<WH3569> said<WH559> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, Put<WH7760> now these rags<WH5499> and worn-out<WH1094> garments<WH4418> under thine armholes<WH679> under the cords<WH2256>. And Jeremiah<WH3414> did so<WH6213>.
So they drew up<WH4900> Jeremiah<WH3414> with the cords<WH2256>, and took him up<WH5927> out of the dungeon<WH953>: and Jeremiah<WH3414> remained<WH3427> in the court<WH2691> of the guard<WH4307>.

Then Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> sent<WH7971>, and took<WH3947> Jeremiah<WH3414> the prophet<WH5030> unto him into the third<WH7992> entry<WH3996> that is in the house<WH1004> of Jehovah<WH3068>: and the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, I will ask<WH7592> thee a thing<WH1697>; hide nothing from me<WH3582>.

Then Jeremiah<WH3414> said<WH559> unto Zedekiah<WH6667>, If I declare<WH5046> it unto thee<WH4191>, wilt thou not surely put me to death<WH4191>? and if I give thee counsel<WH3289>, thou wilt not hearken unto me<WH8085>.

So Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> sware<WH7650> secretly<WH5643> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, saying<WH559>, As Jehovah<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, that made<WH6213> us this soul<WH5315>, I will not put thee to death<WH4191>, neither will I give<WH5414> thee into the hand<WH3027> of these men<WH582> that seek<WH1245> thy life<WH5315>.

Then said<WH559> Jeremiah<WH3414> unto Zedekiah<WH6667>, Thus saith<WH559> Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>, the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>: If thou wilt<WH3318> go forth<WH3318> unto the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>'s princes<WH8269>, then thy soul<WH5315> shall live<WH2421>, and this city<WH5892> shall not be burned<WH8313> with fire<WH784>; and thou shalt live<WH2421>, and thy house<WH1004>.

But if thou wilt not go forth<WH3318> to the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>'s princes<WH8269>, then shall this city<WH5892> be given<WH5414> into the hand<WH3027> of the Chaldeans<WH3778>, and they shall burn<WH8313> it with fire<WH784>, and thou shalt not escape out<WH4422> of their hand<WH3027>.

And Zedekiah<WH6667> the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, I am afraid<WH1672> of the Jews<WH3064> that are fallen<WH5307> away to the Chaldeans<WH3778>, lest they deliver<WH5414> me into their hand<WH3027>, and they mock me<WH5953>.

But Jeremiah<WH3414> said<WH559>, They shall not deliver<WH5414> thee<WH8085>. Obey, I beseech thee<WH6963>, the voice of Jehovah<WH3068>, in that which I speak<WH1696> unto thee<WH3190>: so it shall be well with thee<WH5315>, and thy soul shall live<WH2421>.
But if thou refuse<WH3986> to go forth<WH3318>, this is the word<WH1697> that Jehovah<WH3068> hath showed me<WH7200>:

behold <WH802>, all the women that are left<WH7604> in the king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063>'s house<WH1004> shall be brought forth<WH3318> to the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>'s princes<WH8269>, and those women shall say<WH559>, Thy familiar friends<WH582> have set thee on<WH5496>, and have prevailed<WH3201> over thee<WH7272>: now that thy feet are sunk<WH2883> in the mire<WH1206>, they are turned away<WH5472> back<WH268>.

And they shall bring out<WH3318> all thy wives<WH802> and thy children<WH1121> to the Chaldeans<WH3778>; and thou shalt not escape out<WH4422> of their hand<WH3027>, but shalt be taken<WH8610> by the hand<WH3027> of the king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>: and thou shalt cause this city<WH5892> to be burned<WH8313> with fire<WH784>.
Then said<WH559> Zedekiah<WH6667> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, Let no man<WH376> know<WH3045> of these words<WH1697>, and thou shalt not die<WH4191>.

But if the princes<WH8269> hear<WH8085> that I have talked<WH1696> with thee<WH935>, and they come unto thee<WH559>, and say unto thee<WH5046>, Declare unto us now what thou hast said<WH1696> unto the king<WH4428>; hide<WH3582> it not from us<WH4191>, and we will not put thee to death; also what the king<WH4428> said unto thee<WH1696>:

then thou shalt say<WH559> unto them<WH5307>, I presented my supplication<WH8467> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>, that he would not cause me to return<WH7725> to Jonathan<WH3083>'s house<WH1004>, to die there<WH4191>.

Then came<WH935> all the princes<WH8269> unto Jeremiah<WH3414>, and asked<WH7592> him<WH5046>; and he told them according to all these words<WH1697> that the king<WH4428> had commanded<WH6680>. So they left off speaking<WH2790> with him<WH1697>; for the matter was not perceived<WH8085>.
So Jeremiah<WH3414> abode<WH3427> in the court<WH2691> of the guard<WH4307> until the day<WH3117> that Jerusalem<WH3389> was taken<WH3920>.
